com.strongloop.android.loopback

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.strongloop.android.remoting.VirtualObject
      • com.strongloop.android.loopback.Model
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessToken, User

    public class Model
extends VirtualObject
    A local representative of a single model instance on the server. The data is immediately accessible locally, but can be saved, destroyed, etc. from the server easily.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Model.Callback
      Deprecated. 
      Use {link VoidCallback} instead.

      • getId

        public java.lang.Object getId()

      • get

        public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the value associated with a given key.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for which to return the corresponding value.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key, or null if no value is associated with the key.

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String key,
       java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a given key-value pair to the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for value. If the key already exists in the dictionary, the specified value takes its place.
        value - The value for the key. The value may be null.

      • putAll

        public void putAll(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> params)
        Adds all the specified params to the dictionary.
        Parameters:
        params - The params to add.

      • toMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> toMap()
        Converts the Model (and all of its Java Bean properties) into a Map.
        Overrides:
        toMap in class VirtualObject

      • save

        public void save(VoidCallback callback)
        Saves the Model to the server.

        This method calls toMap() to determine which fields should be saved.

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be executed when finished.

      • destroy

        public void destroy(VoidCallback callback)
        Destroys the Model from the server.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to be executed when finished.
